Comment: Look, I understand the public policy reasons for why he should and should not be returned. Legally, however, I think the administration is wrong.   While they are correct that the court does not have jurisdiction over a citizen of El Salvador in El Salvador, I think the real issue is who are the parties to the case. In this case, the parties include the U.S. Government, who the court **does** have jurisdiction over.   While the court cannot order Garcia to return or El Salvador to release him, it can order the U.S. Government, as a party in the case over which the court has jurisdiction, to expedite his return to the U.S., since the U.S. is the party who deported him to a prison which the U.S. contracts with to maintain him in.  Whether we need to change our immigration laws to make them stricter or create forms of expedited deportations is beyond the scope of this comment.
